title: Sweet Red Wine Selection Guide

items.name: Grenache
items.details: Typically the sweetest among common red wines. Best choice when looking for a sweet red.

items.name: Shiraz
items.details: Can have some sweet notes, making it a decent second choice for sweetness.

items.name: Malbec
items.details: Usually on the drier side. Not ideal if you want something sweet.

items.name: Cabernet Sauvignon
items.details: Generally dry. Not a sweet wine option.

notes: Red blends can vary in sweetness, so check the label. Among Grenache, Shiraz, Malbec, and Cabernet Sauvignon, go with Grenache for the sweetest option.
